name: Lobotomize
description:
The offices of Haas Bioroid: Chronos Protocol division are proud to present the Lobotomize deck, the finest corporate build utilizing anti-Runner technology.

This corporate build aggressively deters any hostile intrusion with the bleeding edge in mind-mapping and brain-imaging research. Early in the build, Enigma and Fenris punish no-icebreaker server intrusion. Later, Bioroid Efficiency Research and Oversight AI provide maximum uptime for your Januses and Heimdall. If they are trashed, fear not; Howler and NBN’s very own Jackson Howard will recur them. Rumor has it that Director Haas is working on a project of her own for that purpose, as well.

Place a Zed 1.0 or Howler on an Awakening Center for unexpected damage. Howlers can also be installed over HQ or R&D as a one-shot deterrence for Account Siphons, Maker’s Eyes, and Indexings. Sufficient funds funnel in by way of company Hedge Funds, Adonis advertising Campaigns, and long-range mining operations on Arrakis. An Oversight AI’d bioroid will protect these assets.

Despite Jinteki and HB’s long-held rivalry, the loyalty of Jinteki’s Zaibatsu conglomerates guarantee the effectiveness of your cerebral overwriters. Install, advance, advance, and have no fear. The Zaibatsu insurance policy is most forgiving.

Arrive at 6 agenda points as quickly as possible to maximize pressure on the Runner. The acquisition of a Sentinel Defense Program along the way similarly mounts pressure. When someone is pressured, they take risks. Risks lead to damage. Damage leads to flatline.

Finally, if the runner is ever kind enough to provide you with their location, this build has one last ace-in-the-hole. Call our corporate allies at the Weyland Consortium and incinerate them. While HB does not endorse the Scorched Earth policy, it recognizes the necessity to sacrifice certain infrastructures in order to ensure the security of its customers.

Every runner is a criminal. Show no mercy. Punish their intrusions. A flatlined runner is the ultimate deterrence. And remember, vote HB for the Chronos Protocol!

name: Exile Recursion Efficiency
description: Attempting another replicator deck with Exile

name: Chaos Scavenge
Tag n'Bad ... pub
Tag n'Bad ... pub
Re-engineering your cerebelum
description: This deck on average lands 2-3 brain damage which then makes neural emp a peice of cake to land.

name: Tag n'Bad ... pub V2
description: Midseason Replacements + Psychographics + Project Vitruvius for more fun ...

name: Shut Archives Down
description: A close idea to Spam that Button, but without showing the runner what you are doing. Use Power Shutdown to add Shocks and 1pt agendas in archives. Use Jackson to remove any Fetal AI and Snares from there and use interns to use archives as an extension to your HQ. do not overuse PS, use it to trash some key runner program. Use Jackson Howard buy ability as a weak Panic Button if you need more damage at the archives. Snoop is just too damn good with a single counter in it. Play it as a no advance, keep Fetal AI and Snares in your hand all the time (you may keep a shock too). Bluff is a central part to make this deck works, so some project junebug may be added if you want. I added paper wall just to keep early pressure at control, and because it works so good with chum.

name: Burn 1.4
description:
More Agenda Diversity, shifted around some of the ice, give the corp a better ability to tag the runner.

Edit: It is bad and I feel bad

name: The world is watching 2.0
description: A basic Fast Advance, Make sure that all of your servers are permeable, you want the runner to be able to get in, just slowly. If you put down a tollbooth or a heimidall too early they will just work on their economy and draw breakers. Yu want them to run lean, that way you can hit them with midseason. PSF is a threat, but not a promise.

name: LLDS Processing with Exile 1.2b
description: Variation on Dragon53170's deck. +2 Account Siphon, +3 R&D Interface, +1 Scavenge. More threat on centrals, more heap shenanigans.

name: RFA 1.0
description:
Really-Fast-Advance

The point of this deck is do deploy ice as speed bumps while you generate money. Once you can deploy your san-san you can out-of hand deploy pdf. Get an Astroscript finished and you can deploy restructured. Snoop helps you know what tricks are coming up.

15 credits is the magic number, with that you can score anything!

name: The Screamer! v1.1
description: Whirlpool + Howler in NEXT Design. Keep the runner out, or just make them a drooling vegetable!

name: Competitive Shell Game
description:
This deck is a shell game deck, leaving most if not all of your remotes unprotected, advanced, and dangerous.

Only ICEing centrals with taxing sentries, and laying down Victor's on R&D, Janus for the occasional surprise ... yes, you'll have the money for it.

The point of this deck is to bleed the runner dry of clicks. Get them to click through a Victor just to run your melange or Sundew, get the runner to run when they aren't fully prepped.

Your standard turns will often be install/adv/adv or melanging till the runner can't stand it, or CB and install ICE.

The deck worked well for me, but you're really gotta play poker with the runner. This deck doesn't work as an agenda scoring machine, its a mind game for the runner, often stressing them and causing them to make mistakes. Early game mind games look a bit like: Once you've got a piece of ICE rezed on HQ/R&D, doing things like install card A, advance advance install card B, advance advance Advance Card A (Score), install card C, advance.

You've got to do things that make old advancement tokens still dangerous, so, really, bluffing and daring the runner to call you, truly treating early agendas like traps makes old traps still somewhat dangerous. Unpredictable, but not necessarily reckless play is what makes the deck work for me.

Inspired by: Bad Publicity's Sly Squid's Shell Game Deck

Hope you enjoy playing it as much as I have.

name: Professor Toolbox
description:
First time building Prof. Criticism welcomed.

Built using 1 core & 1 C&C

name: Gabe Femme Recursion
description:
Recur Femme with Scavenge and keep the pressure on the corp banks with Forged Act. Orders and Account Syphon. Criticism welcomed.

Made with 1 core and 1 C&C

name: Weyland Monster ice
description:
What can you do with a lot of bad publicity?

This deck is designed to make utter heaps of cash, and puts it to use on making big static defenses. Huge ice leave you vulnerable to derez effects, but I frequently have ~30 credits floating, so I can sweat 1 or 2 derez. Cash also helps keep the threat of sea source hanging out there over their heads.

This deck can fairly consistently rez big ice on both HQ and archives to protect itself from cheap shutdowns. And when it makes a remote fort, boy is it expensive to get in. To make big ice effective, you have to be able to drag the runner down that column of ice. To that end, I have 6 copies of cards that can be played for a beneficial effect, and vanish as the runner passes the last ice. Mills clears your bad pub (you will have a lot!), and jackson reshuffles your economy, all while forcing the runner to make a move.

Naturally to apply the above concept, you need to be rushing out agendas. Putting down a govt contracts behind a hadrians with an ireress on top (to prevent inside job), lets you get to near match point with 1 more agenda (project atlas with 2 counters = game...pretty much). This plays very rushy, while forcing both breakers and economy, while still threatening a sea source (runner blows their cash beating the ice).

Now the elephant in the room. Why Ireress?? Funny thing happens with ireress....if you have no other ice that requires a code gate breaker, they have to dump 5 on yog to offset bad pub, which is a tough value proposition. I left tollbooth in because it still costs yog 3 IF yog can even beat it. Otherwise its fully functional against any other code gate breaker. Ireress is a lot better when you give yog no other purpose. Also, free inside job protection!

Possible edits: Instead of Janus, Muckraker seems to be a good option, surprise tagging (only rez when they'll stick), and you can clear the bad pub with elizabeth. Janus is more fun to make double scorch viable past a plascrete, or early game when the plascretes aren't out yet, and grip is their protection.

Veterans program: No space for this, but would be interesting if I started using illicit ice like swarm, right now half of my bad pub in a game is from hostile takeover, so it would make no sense to swap VP in.

Thoughts?

name: Run Hard(ware)
description:
Build a big rig, quickly, run hard...

  • replicator + capstone to draw cards,
  • Aesop/Prof contact for economy,
  • atmens for efficient runs,
  • keyhole to attack quickly R&D,

Some tricks: stimhack/clonechip to install a large atman, escher to weaken R&D for Atman, use aesop's to sell stuff, even plascrete/SMC/empty datasucker if needed.

Untested yet, comments are welcome

name: NBN FA v2
NBN FA & eco tagpunish
description: inspired by http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/1772/chilo-city-grudge-match-01-25-2014-winner

name: Punishment
description:
This was my attempt at designing a less passive corp. Aside from the massive amount of tag-and-otherwise punishment operations, the deck also includes a lot of "annoying" Ice, such as Data Hound and Sherlock 1.0. I'm working under the assumption that throwing the runner off his game is almost as good as keeping him out of your servers. The two barriers, Enigma, Tollbooth and Viktor will hopefully be enough EtR to keep the Runner at bay, otherwise. Red Herrings also helps here.

Might be a bit low on tagging with only Data Raven and Restructured Data Pool as active taggers, but ChiLo turns a lot of my cards into pretty nasty taggers at a low price.

Amazon helps getting the Ice setup cheaply, but anti-synergizes a bit with ChiLo. Otherwise economy is dependent on Gila and Hedge Funds.

This deck was designed with a limited card pool in mind: Core, What Lies Ahead, Trace Amount, Humanity's Shadow and Creation & Control

name: The NEXT Level v2.0
description: Changes from v1.0: - 3 Ice Wall for 3 Paper Wall - 3 Beanstalk for 3 Sweeps Week - 3 Datapike for 3 Enigma - 1 Wall of Static for 1 Janus 1.0

name: Heilaskaða v1.2
description:
I built this deck based on a post someone made about making a deck based off of brain damage. I've been able to test it once so far and it looks pretty good. I'm almost certain I copied the suggested card-for-card but I've been curious about trying to fit Howler or Data Mine somewhere.

The problem I have is in my meta most people play expose cards and I'm betting it's going to be hard to keep traps on my servers because they just play something to get around them or simply focus run my R&D to win.

(The name means brain damage in Icelandic due to fact that Fenris is by far my favorite card in the deck.)
